title: Cruel lout urinated on homeless man as he tried to sleep outside railway station

A lout who urinated on a homeless man as he slept outside a railway station has been jailed. 
Shaun Layton, 23, relieved himself on the rough sleeper who was resting in the entrance of the train station in Worcester on September 16 last year. 
Layton, of Malvern, Worcs., admitted outraging public decency and causing racially aggravated fear or provocation of violence by words after arguing with a passerby. 
He was jailed for 25 weeks and ordered to pay £135 costs at Redditch Magistrate’s Court . 
After the case, Superintendent Kevin Purcell, of West Mercia Police , said: “This was a particularly horrible crime which is reflected in the custodial sentence. 
“We are working with partners at this time to ensure the issues around the many 
aspects of homelessness are considered and addressed collectively. 
“This is in order that the risk to vulnerable people is reduced. 
“I would encourage anyone who wishes to support homeless people in Worcester financially to do so by donations to one of our recognised shelters or charities who work hard to offer support.” 
Layton is also due to appear at Worcester Magistrates Court on March 31, on two charges assault by beating on October 16 last year. Like us on Facebook
